review_title: Managing case load of mentally ill
pros: Not stuck in office all day long
cons: Over worked and lots of wear and tear on car

review_title: Do not work or become client here
job_title: Case Management Supervisor in Columbus, OH
pros: All cons they screw up medicines and no case Management that really helps they all lazy and can't keep no one as Management Disrespectful Untrustworthy They need to be shut down The whole company is trash Never helps clients with their needs
cons: Bad staffing trash never picks up messes up peoples medicines never does anything right always bad mouthing clients and can't keep workers cause they want everything their way and not no one else's

review_title: Great for experience but takes a toll on your own mental health.
pros: Experience, friendly co-workers, ability to work remotely at times.
cons: Severely understaffed to dangerous levels, unrealistic productivity requirements, takes a toll on personal vehicles, not a progressive company, profits over people, high cost of benefits, unsafe working conditions in the community, lack of PTO, pressure to work from home when sick, required to still make productivity when taking PTO or Sick Time or your pay will be less, horrendous company vans/vehicles.

job_title: Psych Nurse Practitioner in Columbus, OH
cons: no cons to report about the company

review_title: Didn't make enough for what we were expected to do
pros: Good office environment/supervisors who were knowledgeable
cons: Even with a psychology degree, we worked with almost unmanageable cases.

pros: North Central Mental Health Services has great health and dental benefits. They also help a lot of people within the community throughout Franklin County.
cons: I don't really want to discuss that kind of stuff because overall coming into North Central right after college is a great entry level place, to learn and educate yourself further with what you want to become.

pros: You are able to create your own schedule. You will create great relationships with your clients.
cons: There is minimal training. The company cares about how much money you are making them and not the quality of care the clients are receiving.

review_title: Great company and co-workers within the ADAMH system.
pros: Scheduling, benefits, work perks of casual business atmosphere.
cons: Billable services required through the ADAMH and State systems.

review_title: Make it here, and you'll make it anywhere.
pros: NCMHS has a terrific reputation for the services delivered. Highly qualified, dedicated people head up the treatment teams.  This is the place to learn how to excel at delivering social services.
cons:
The job brings 60  hours per week of responsibilities. Unlicensed employees get 40 hours per week to do them in.  Employees who don't meet productivity expectations are on the sidewalk fast. Those vacation days you were promised?  If you aren't meeting productivity, you can forget about them. Those electronic hand-readers by the doorway? They aren't for security. They're to make sure that unlicensed employees don't spend one second more or one second less than exactly forty hours per week on the job.

Folks do find ways to meet productivity honestly and ethically. You will want to start looking for help and advice on how to do that from the minute you start.

pros: Decent benefits, good manager (on the team I worked on), great learning experience.
cons: Negative atmosphere, high turnover, low pay.

review_title: I was desperate to leave quickly.
pros:
Overtime wasn't required often for certain employees.
Insurance benefits were available.
There were potlucks and monthly employee meetings where light breakfast was provided and employees were recognized for various accomplishments. 
Most of the employees were kind and friendly.
cons:
Low pay
Too strict with clock-in/out times
Some employees were severely disgruntled.
Seemed like there was a relatively high employee turnover rate 
Requesting time off was like pulling teeth; you have to put in the request way in advance.
The agency doesn't close in the event of inclement weather or natural disasters. You're still expected to come to work.

pros: A great place to start a career.  Great training in social services and mental health.
cons: Pay is lower than average for a non-profit organization which already are on the low end of the salary scale.

review_title: Case management is very rewarding, but NCMHS has unrealistic expectations and does not adequately support their staff.
pros: The clients can be very rewarding to work with, and I love the case managers, nurses and doctors
cons: North Central has a productivity (read: billed hours) quota which is unrealistic, and the structure of the agency is set against recognizing it.

review_title: It all seemed great at first....
pros: Helping the Clients in the community.
cons: Poor Management. Social Workers oversee the nurses that go out and do home visits/work in the clinic. It makes zero sense at all.A Social Worker has zero clue or understanding a nurses job & the liability that comes along with being a nurse.....

pros: The clients are great! Yeah you have a lot of freedom with this job. Rarely will you experience people constantly looking over your shoulder. Opportunities to be creative
cons: Stressful due to productivity. Community work is difficult on vehicle. Very cliquish work environment. Constant drama - co-workers can be very disrespectful to staff and clients.

Extremely low pay. They will hire literally anyone and will take advantage of fresh graduates. A college grad should not be making 20k a year full time. Ridiculous micromanaging and constant drama with team managers

pros: Some freedom while in the community
cons: Company only cares about money, wear and tear on your own car, will fire you if you are sick for a week
